title: Right Hand Handlebar - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
The right hand handlebar can be identified by the single identification mark (+).
Fit a new circlip to the handlebar
Position the handlebar so that the circlip is flush against the edge of the handlebar clamp and the alignment mark is central to the split line of the handlebar clamp.
Tighten the handlebar clamp bolts in the following sequence:
Retighten the outer clamp bolt to
Fit the right hand switch housing retaining clip to the handlebar as noted during removal.
Slide the right hand switch housing onto the handlebar and over the retaining clip until it locks into position.
The switch housing electrical connections are recessed into the switch housing body.

When inserting the connectors, carefully locate the connectors into their sockets, then use a suitable flat ended pin punch to push the connectors fully home. An audible click can be heard when the connectors are fully inserted.
Do not use sharp tools, such as a flat bladed screw driver, to insert the connectors.
Do not secure both harnesses to the tab with a single cable tie.
Securing the black harness electrical connectors harness to the tab with a cable tie may cause the electrical connector to become dislodged.
A dislodged electrical connector may cause intermittent operation of the switches.
The grey harness electrical connector is fitted closest to the tab and secured with a single cable tie.
The black harness electrical connector is fitted furthest away from the tab and secured with a second cable tie to the harness with the grey connector.
Make sure the braided sheath is secured using the cable tie and not the individual wires.
Connect the right hand switch housing electrical connectors.
Secure the wiring harness with the grey electrical connector to the socket closest to the tab with a new cable tie.
Push the braided sheath until it comes into contact with the rubber grommet and then secure to the harness with the black connector using a second cable tie.
If removed , fit a new spring clip over the handlebar inner weight, making sure the rubber bush is secured as shown.
If removed, fit the spring clip, making sure the two tabs are visible in the handlebar holes.
Position the front brake master cylinder assembly to the handlebar. Fit the clamp (Up arrow pointing upwards) and clamp fixings.
Align the split line of the master cylinder clamp to the alignment mark on the upper surface of the handlebar and tighten the clamp fixings to

Move the handlebars to left and right full lock while checking that the brake hose, clutch cable and electrical harnesses do not bind or that the steering feels tight or difficult to turn. A hose, cable or harness that binds, or steering that is tight/difficult to turn will restrict the steering and may cause loss of control and an accident.

Check for correct operation of the front brake, clutch and twist grip. Check that the brake hose, clutch cable and electrical harnesses do not bind or restrict the steering when the handlebars are turned from lock-to-lock. Rectify as necessary.
